scheme_name: PMMSY: Fish Feed Plants of Production Capacity of at least 100 Ton/Day - Haryana
brief_description: This scheme provides capital subsidy for setting up fish feed plants with a minimum production capacity of 100 tons per day, under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) to general , schedule caste and women beneficiaries .
detailed_description: The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Fish Feed Plants of Production Capacity of at least 100 Ton/Day, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide capital subsidy for setting up fish feed plants with a minimum production capacity of 100 tons per day. The objective is to enhance the availability of high-quality and affordable feed for fish farmers, supporting the expansion of aquaculture in Haryana. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, under which the project is jointly funded by the Central and State Governments: 50% of the subsidy amount is contributed by the Central Government, and 50% is provided by the State Government. Beneficiaries are expected to operate and maintain the plant independently and ensure the supply of feed to fishers at affordable prices.
benefits: A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP). The applicant must own land or hold a registered lease of at least 10 years. The applicant must be willing to operate, maintain, and manage the feed plant after its construction. The applicant must ensure that the feed plant provides an affordable feed supply to fishers and fish farmers. The applicant must submit a valid Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) in accordance with PMMSY guidelines. The applicant must hold a valid training certificate relevant to feed mill operation and maintenance. The applicant must ensure that the land is free from legal disputes and must provide a valid land title.
